title: PolarizationOptics
description: This element describes a Polarization device positioned in the Ligth Path for this Instrument. A Polarization device is an optical filter rotatable through 360° that lets light waves of a specific polarization pass through while blocking light waves of other polarizations. This element can be associated with an optional Optics Turret.

subCategoriesOrder.ManufacturerSpec: This describes the Manufacturer specifications for this component (i.e., Manufacturer Name, Model designation and Catalog Number).
subCategoriesOrder.PolarizationOptics: This element describes a Polarization device positioned in the Ligth Path for this Instrument. A Polarization device is an optical filter rotatable through 360° that lets light waves of a specific polarization pass through while blocking light waves of other polarizations. This element can be associated with an optional Optics Turret.
subCategoriesOrder.WavelengthRange: This element records the Range of Wavelengths this device is designed for according to the Manufacturer. Multiple of this element may be used.

Name.description: A User-defined Name for this component.

ID.description: A Unique Identifier for this component.

Function.description: This field records whether this Polarization Optics is used to generate (Polarizer) or to analyze (Analyzer) polarized light.

CrossPolarizer.description: This field records whether (True) or not (False) this Polarization Optics is a combination of an Analyzer and a Polarizer positioned orthogonal to each other.

DIC.description: This field records whether (True) or not (False) this PolarizationOptics is used for Differential Interference Contrast (DIC) microscopy.

BeamSplitter.description: This field records whether (True) or not (False) this is PolarizationOptics has a beam splitter function.

FaradayIsolator.description: This field records whether (True) or not (False) this PolarizationOptics is a Fraday Isolator. A Faraday Isolator is an optical component which allows light to pass through in only ONE direction and therefore protects laser systems against back reflection. It uses the Faraday magneto-optical effect to turn the polarization of light between various polarizers.

Construction.description: This field records the modality with which this PolarizationOptics is constructed.

Retardation.description: This field records the Phase shift that exists between the polarized light component projected along the fast axis and the part projected along the slow axis.

Fabrication.description: This field records the way in with which this PolarizationOptics is fabricated.

MaterialName.description: This field records the chemical composition or the nonproprietary trade designation of the Material this Polarization Optics is made of.

GlassCode.description: If available, this field records the international Glass Code of the material that constitutes this Lens. The Glass Code designation is based on U.S. military standard MIL-G-174, and it consists of a six-digit number specifying the glass according to its Refractive Index nd at the Fraunhofer d- (or D3-) line, and its Abbe Number Vd also taken at that line. The resulting Glass Code is the value of nd-1 rounded to three digits, followed by Vd rounded to three digits, with all decimal points ignored. For example, BK7 has nd = 1.5168 and Vd = 64.17, giving a six-digit Glass Code of 517642.

Manufacturer.description: This field refers to the company, research group or individual who built or manufactured this hardware component.

Model.description: This field refers to the Model name or any other designation the Manufacturer uses for this component.

CatalogNumber.description: This field records the Catalog, Part or Serial Number used by the Manufacturer to uniquely identify this component.

LotNumber.description: The Lot Number used by the Manufacturer to refer to a specific production batch or lot for this component.

SpecsFile.title: SpecsFile
SpecsFile.description: This element refers to a PDF file that contains the specifications for this hardware component as provided by the Manufacturer.

WavelengthRange.description: This element records the Range of Wavelengths this device is designed for, according to the Manufacturer. Multiple of this element may be used.

PeakWavelength.description: This field records the Wavelength associated with the peak response rate of this device.

CutOn.description: CutOn is the Wavelength below which the response rate is below 50%.

CutOff.description: CutOff is the Wavelength above which the response rate is below 50%.

WavelengthProfile.description: The location of a file containing the Wavelength profile of this hardware component.

Description.title: Description
Description.description: This is an empty element that refers to an Annotation (typically a Comment Annotation that consists of a simple multi-line comment) describing this component.

Tier.description: The tier level of this component.
